description: One-minute skill: Dodd-Frank: Rewriting the Rules.

hook.text: In 2010, the U.S. passed Dodd-Frank â€” 848 pages of new rules to prevent another financial crisis.

buildup.text: Banks had to hold more capital, submit to stress tests, and prove borrowers could repay their loans.

discovery.text: The 'ability to repay' rule ended the NINJA loans and liar loans that fueled the bubble.

twist.text: Banks lobbied hard against the rules. By 2018, many regulations had been rolled back for smaller banks.

climax.text: Dodd-Frank made the system safer â€” but the question remains whether it made it safe enough.

punchline.text: New rules were written. Old habits were harder to change.
